intro: Carduus × stangii nothosubsp. stangii, commonly known as the Stangii thistle, is a hybrid plant species within the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its spiny, lobed leaves and purple to pinkish flower heads that resemble those of other thistle species. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is native to parts of Europe and the Middle East. It exhibits a compact growth habit with a short, upright stem. Due to its ornamental value and hardy nature, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
